# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is a simple function in Julia that accomplishes this:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), " " => "_")
end
```
This function works by first converting the input string to lower case, then removing any leading or trailing whitespaces using `strip`, and finally replacing all spaces with underscores using `replace`. 

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
println(clean_column("My Column")) # Outputs "my_column"
```
